intro: Schismatoglottis sublaxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered schismatoglottis, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes many flowering plants with complex floral structures. The plant typically features dark green, strap-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pale green flowers arranged in a raceme. It is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit and is often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant.
